course_title: Topics in Somatic Practices: Applied Yoga
class_notes:
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


Preference given to dance majors and minors. Contact Anna Leo, aleo@emory.edu for a permission number.


Applied Yoga is designed for dancers and athletes seeking new ways to inform their area of physical study. Through the study and practice of yoga poses and self-observation, students will apply yoga concepts to their specific area of physical training. Students will gain new or deeper insight into the workings of their bodies through personalized investigations.
course_description: Somatic movement education builds a relationship between the body and mind by guiding the mover through a process of full body integration. A variety of somatic practices may be covered, including Bartenieff Fundamentals, Iyengar-based yoga, and core movement training. Somatic practices can be applied to everyday activities and performance, affecting levels of confidence and encouraging authenticity.
